data.text: Bicycle Touring in Taiwan as a Solo Woman

Has anyone cycled Taiwan? I only have a few weeks break over Christmas so am thinking that might be a good option. What‚Äôs everyone‚Äôs thoughts on Taiwan as a cycling destination in general and also for a solo woman? Also I am open to other suggestions for destinations. Pic of me in Uzbekistan on a previous tour.
Looking for replies too... ;-)

data.text: I haven't done it yet but a friend of mine has. She was solo and said it was a great time.

data.text: Hi , you can do it solo in Taiwan i live here for 30 years safe and good to cycling especially the mountains side

data.text: East Coast is wonderful. But if you are up for some really great climbing please consider the two cross island routes. With Sun Lake and Alishan between them also. Taroko Gorge really is a MUST ride. Fabulous scenery and brilliant hiking also

data.text: It is not being called, THE KINGDOM OF CYCLING without good reason. Best place in the world to cycle. Cyclists are being treated as royalty. Do go!!! You will not regard it. We circumnavigated this awesome place in 2019. You can rent a touring bike through the Giant Rent a Bike scheme and hand it back a another location. English spoken by all the young people.

data.text: Dear Amy, I lived in Taiwan many years ago. The people are very friendly. Most signs are bilingual Chinese/English. There is a dude that lives there named Graham Finch. He had lots of good, current info that you can find on the Crazyguyonabike website. Jia yo! Peter
data.author: Peter Andress

data.text: I have a similar set up to yours - but I get bad frame wobble. Thoughts?
data.author: Peter Lehman

data.text: I‚Äôm an engineer. Just a quick look at your frame tube size, it appears as a very small diameter. This is directly proportional to flex and you may be getting into oscillations at certain harmonics, known as resonance. Simplest fix is to find a stiffer frame with larger diameter tubes
data.author: –î—Ä–∞–≥–ø—É—Ç–∏–Ω –®–∞—ô–∏–≤—ü–∏—ò–∞

data.text: Probably doing that. Also going to try moving panniers to maximize mass between axles. I had started with food in the front on advice to keep it low and heavy in the front but then put the food in the back and clothes in the front and that made a huge difference. It is a full chromoly purpose built touring bike with mounting points on the forks. Thanks!
data.author: Peter Lehman

data.text: Make sure you leave the coastal road for the mountains. Come down through the gorge to Hualian.
data.author: Robert Hart

data.text: Concentrate your efforts in the east coast, the west coast is really meh ü´§ with all the urban centers and factories üè≠, the local trains that stop at every station allow bikes on when it‚Äôs not busy, so they‚Äôre life savers when you‚Äôre pressed for time
data.author: Arthur Wengen

data.text: Welcome to my country "Taiwan", it's the best country to solo woman cyclist. If you want to add drinking water or borrow pump on the way, you can go to police station to look for helping. Feel free to ask any questions about Taiwan to meüôÇ
data.author: Yu-chiao Lin

data.text: you can also free camp at some police staion on the east coast
data.author: Marie Bardet

data.text: I agree with everyone Taiwan is a fabulous place to cycle ( also hiking is fantastic) I have been 5 times and am also wanting to go next month to cycle again. BUT be warned Taiwan is still closed to Tourists, so for now you need to postpone or consider other possibilities.
data.author: Anthony Welsh

data.text: how to get current info on this. . . Was just looking into it and thought it was open. Also heard that Japan is opening up to solo travel again (i had heard Japan was closed to solo travelers). I thought south Korea and Taiwan were ok. . .
data.author: Colin Leath

data.text: Hi colin leath. I live and work in Singapore currently, so keep updated for our business travel here. Best to check on Govt websites though as situation can change weekly. Taiwan is considering opening for tourists soon. But no tentative date given. Korea yes is possible and Japan which has only been allowing tourist groups is about to allow individual tourists to enter soon
data.author: Anthony Welsh

data.text: Agree with above. East coast is less populous , as suggested on the highways use the nice wide scooter lanes. Signs in English and Chinese on roads. People vey honest. Food great and not overly expensive. I think it would be very safe for a single female. Great cycle lanes along the river in Taipei. Can use 7 11 stores to forward excess baggage etc to another town ( like postal/courier service ). Bikes permissible on local trains fully assembled and broken down on longer distance trains. A good ride would be top to bottom east coast and back up Rift Valley. Make sure to eat at local night markets.
data.author: Ross Mayberry

data.text: TAROKO - For the brave.

data.text: we cycle from yilan up to lishan in 3 days and then riding down taroko

data.text: I live in Taiwan, had solo biked thru Taiwan in 2018. It‚Äôs pretty safe for female solo biking in Taiwan, hostels is cheap, convenient stores are everywhere, strong northeast monsoon wind is expected in winter, it‚Äôs best to ride from north coast down east coast to avoid headwind, the best coastal view is route 26 eastern Pintung coast. Bon voyage
